Complete the plotting data.frame

Source: R/plotting.R
INTERNAL_extract_plotting_data.Rd

Fully define all of the data to be stored in a data.frame for ggplot construction. This ensures that the data acquisition is separated from the plotting.

.extract_plotting_data(data_cmds, param_choices, all_memory,
  all_coordinates, se, by_row = FALSE)

Arguments

data_cmds

A list of character vectors containing commands to initialize the plotting data.frame.
param_choices

A single-row DataFrame that contains all the input settings for the current panel.
all_memory

A list of DataFrames, where each DataFrame corresponds to a panel type and contains the settings for each individual panel of that type.
all_coordinates

A list of data.frames, where each data.frame contains the x/y coordinates of data points on a specific plot (named by the encoded panel name).
se

A SingleCellExperiment object.
by_row

A logical vector indicating whether this data.frame is for a row-based plot.

Value

A list containing cmd_list, itself a list containing:

  • data, a character vector containing commands to generate the plotting data.frame.

  • select, a character vector containing commands to add SelectBy information to the plotting data.frame.

  • specific, a character vector containing commands to generate plot-type-specific commands, e.g., scatter for violin plots.

The top-level list also contains envir, an environment that is guaranteed to hold plot.data and plot.type entries.

Finally, the top-level list will contain color_lab, a string specifying how to label the color scale in the ggplot.

Details

The output envir is guaranteed to contain a plot.data data.frame. This is the fully constructed data.frame from evaluation of cmds, containing all plotting information required to generate a ggplot object. The fields present in plot.data are:

  • X and Y, specifying the x- and y-coordinates, respectively. All categorical variables are guaranteed to be factors, and everything else must be numeric.

  • ColorBy, specifying how to colour each point from the .define_color_for_*_plots functions. As above, this is either a factor or numeric.

  • SelectBy, a logical field specifying whether the points were selected by a point selection in a transmitting plot. If selecting points to restrict, any subsetting will already have been applied.

The nature of the plot to be generated will determine whether any additional fields are present in plot.data. Violin plots will contain GroupBy fields as well as jitteredX. In horizontal violin plots, the values of X and Y will be swapped in preparation for coord_flip in .create_plot. Square plots will have jitteredX and jitteredY.

The envir$plot.type variable will specify the type of plot for correct dispatch in .create_plot. The environment may also contain plot.data.all, see .process_selectby_choice for details.

See also

.define_colorby_for_column_plot, .define_colorby_for_row_plot, .process_selectby_choice

Contents

  • Value
